title: Health input app with tailored food recommendations (frontend)

requirements.summary: Create a health input form (age, weight, conditions, systolic/diastolic BP) with a primary “Search Foods” button that validates and fetches recommendations, showing loading and results.
acceptanceCriteria: The main form includes fields for: Age, Weight, Systolic BP, Diastolic BP, and Sicknesses/Health conditions (free text and/or tag input).
The primary call-to-action button text is exactly “Search Foods”.
Client-side validation prevents submission with empty required fields or obviously invalid numeric values and shows clear English error messages.
On submit, the UI shows a loading state and then renders the recommended foods returned by the backend.

file_operations.description: Create the main app view that renders the health input form and orchestrates the submit flow (validate → call backendInterface.getFoodRecommendations → display results). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Input, Textarea, Button) to implement consistent form controls and a primary button labeled exactly “Search Foods”. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a React hook (TypeScript, no JSX) that wraps the backend call to getFoodRecommendations and exposes loading/error states for the form submit flow (suitable for React Query usage already present in the app).

Implement client-side validation helpers for required fields and sensible numeric ranges (age/weight positive; BP systolic/diastolic present and within reasonable bounds), returning clear English error messages for display in the UI.
Ensure the app bootstraps the newly created App component cleanly and that required providers remain intact; keep user-facing text in English.

requirements.summary: Add a results view showing recommended foods with explanations, a medical disclaimer, and an easy way to edit inputs.
acceptanceCriteria: Results are displayed as a readable list/cards with food name and explanation.
A disclaimer is visible on the results view (e.g., “This app provides general food suggestions and is not medical advice.”).
Users can easily go back and adjust inputs without losing usability (e.g., a Back/Edit Inputs button or link).

file_operations.description: Create a results view component that renders the returned FoodRecommendation list as readable cards (food + explanation) and includes a clear English disclaimer that the app is not medical advice. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Alert) for layout and messaging. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the ResultsView into the main flow so that, after successful fetch, the results display replaces/appears below the form and includes an Edit Inputs/Back control that returns the user to the form with previous values preserved.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive health/nutrition visual theme across the app, avoiding a blue/purple-dominated primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent theme applied across input and results views (background, typography, buttons, and cards).
Primary palette is not dominated by blue and purple.
Layout is clean and accessible (clear labels, adequate contrast, readable font sizes).

file_operations.description: Create global styling and theme tokens (e.g., CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn-ui) to establish a cohesive health/nutrition look (e.g., greens, warm neutrals) with accessible contrast and readable typography; ensure the primary palette is not dominated by blue/purple.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions as needed to support the chosen non-blue/purple primary palette and consistent spacing/typography across form and results.

Apply the theme consistently in the app layout (page background, header/hero section, spacing) and ensure form/results components use the same design language via composed shadcn-ui components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and render generated static imagery from the frontend as static assets.
acceptanceCriteria: New images (from image requirements) are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
UI references these images via static paths and they render correctly in the browser.
No backend endpoints are added for image hosting/serving.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero illustration asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/healthy-foods-hero.dim_1400x600.png for static serving by the frontend build.
Add the generated app icon asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/health-app-icon.dim_256x256.png for static serving by the frontend build.
Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/health-app-icon.dim_256x256.png as the site icon so it renders in the browser tab.

Render the hero image frontend/public/assets/generated/healthy-foods-hero.dim_1400x600.png in the app UI (e.g., in a top hero/header section attached to the existing main view) without introducing backend image serving.
